turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No... I don't really know where he is yet. I'm at a hotel around the corner.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Man, that is love.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: You can go get your stuff right now. I'll walk you down.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, that's not, I couldn't...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Listen, when someone does the kind of thing you did, you gotta do something in return. So, you stay with me until you find your David and live happily ever after. Okay?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: I got this apartment with a guy.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: The one you were telling me about?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: No, this one was worse... I had to have the place sprayed when he left. Twice... He was two guys before the last one -- not counting a little office thing in there, which I'm trusting you with, 'cause if it gets out, I'm on the street...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's lovely... I really like your aquarium.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Yeah, well, at least fish don't use your razor or pee on the seat...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hmmm. Sounds like you've had a pretty tough go of it with men...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Oh, I dunno... but just once I wish I'd run into a guy who noticed the Koi before my tits.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hey, Rosa... it's Betty. How do you get to this town called 'Tustin?' It's in Orange County...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Tustin? Take the Hollywood Freeway to the Five...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: The Five?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Just look for the really crowded road and follow that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Okay... oh, umm, would you mind if I borrowed some clothes?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Huh? Sure, look in my closet, take any dress you want!  We're still on for tonight, right?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: You made it! Hey, that looks great on you. 'S classy...  So, how'd it go today? You find him?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Ummm... no, no. Different 'Ravell.'

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You know, the more I think about it, this really isn't David's kind of place.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: What are you talking about? This bar is packed with professional people!  Everybody says if you're going to get married, this is the spot to meet someone... Luckily, I'm currently off men, so I've got the luxury of not giving a shit.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I know what you mean, I recently had some trouble with a man, a different man... and David's still getting over Leslie.  His wife.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: He has a wife?!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Had. She died in a car accident last year. She was decapitated.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: God, that's awful!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It may not have been an accident. They never did find her head...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Her 'head'?! You're making this up...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, no! Well, see, she was having an affair with a Russian diplomat who I believe was mixed up with the Mafia...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Jesus, I thought my love life was crazy...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: ...so, we'll hit the library first and fan out from there. They've got all the L.A. phone books, plus medical directories...  We're not gonna let him hide from you any more, okay? I'm making this my personal mission.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: David isn't hiding from me, I left him standing at the altar six years ago and now I'm...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Fuck the details, they're always to blame... Look, too many of these guys duck out on us, especially after they become doctors or lawyers. I see it at my company all day long! So I'm just gonna make sure you get your, you know, fairy tale ending or whatever...  One of us should.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Rosa, I can't believe you're doing all this for me... thank you.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Hey, how 'bout a card for me? What is that?  "Please call if you have any information on David Ravell." This is my phone number! How many of these have you given out?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: How many men have I talked to?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Jesus! They're all gonna be calling me!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You said in L.A., anything goes.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: I was talking about what you could wear!

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Guess who I saw today.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Doctor David Ravell.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What? Where was he?!

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: ON TELEVISION!!  Cut the shit, will you!

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Either you're making a fool out of me because you get off on it, or you got serious problems. Which one is it?!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I have no idea what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: I'M TALKING ABOUT DAVID RAVELL!!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Shhh! I heard you the first time.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: I spent my weekend looking for someone who does -- not -- exist. I should have been here at the hospital with my brother, but I was with you.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: If you didn't want to do it, you should have said so! Is this about gas money?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: IT'S NOT ABOUT GAS MONEY!!  You have a thing for an actor on a stupid white soap opera, and we searched all over town for his character! Not the actor -- whose name is George, by the way. His character!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Why'd you help me in the first place?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: I helped you because I'm an idiot! Ask my mother, I love it when people take advantage of me! I TRUSTED YOU!! I THOUGHT HE WAS REAL!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: HE IS REAL!!

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: I'm not going back on our arrangement. My word is good, and my family owes you. But I think it's best for both of us if you get your own place as soon as you can.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Don't worry, I'm looking... just taking a tiny break.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: This is crazy. I come home, you go to your room. You go in the kitchen, I go to my room. It's stupid.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: So what do you say? Can we be friends?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...okay.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What are those for?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Oh, it's a charity dinner. The money goes to a good cause, but I don't have anybody to go with...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Umm...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Looking for someone?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: You never know who you'll see.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Were you with him this whole time?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, God! You scared me! Yes...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: You still in love?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Does he know you think he's real?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He is real.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Uh-huh... So, what'd you talk about?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, my gosh, everything! My trip out here, what we've both been doing, you know...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: No, I'm not sure I could begin to imagine... So, where'd you go?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: To a party in the Hollywood Hills.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Was it a huge place? With a view of the whole world?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes. I'd never been in a place like that before.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: I have, lots of times. My mother used to clean them. I used to piss in their pools.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: This isn't fair, you know. Do you always get what you want?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, almost never.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: But, you're in love with someone who doesn't exist. You come here, you meet this guy, who should laugh in your face, and instead you leave with him!  Betty, you are one-of-a-kind...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Are you sure I can borrow this?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: No, please. Go ahead, it's your funeral...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Rosa...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Well, what if this guy's just playing with you? What if he's lying about who he is?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You should have a little faith in people.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Does he ever talk about medicine? His patients, the hospital?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: All the time. It's always "Loma Vista" this, "Loma Vista" that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Rosa, so you've met David?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Sure did! And a funny thing, Betty, he introduced himself to me as George!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, he does that.  It's this silly game he plays. Half the people who know him call him George.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm going back to... I need to... I don't know.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: ...this is your sweater, right?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I have to leave now.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: What? No, I'm not gonna let you just run out of here... You need to talk about what's going on...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You think I'm crazy, Rosa, but you don't know the half of it. My husband was, ahh...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Your husband?!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes, I had a husband and he was killed two weeks ago in my kitchen. I was right there...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: What?! That you had something to do with it?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't know. I'm just starting to remember it now. I don't...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Yeah, but your running away isn't going to help you with all this...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There was blood everywhere, Rosa. I saw it, I think I watched the whole thing happen... Oh my God...

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Okay, okay, look, ummm... Let's just talk a little first and you'll feel better, I promise.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: These guys are here to help you, Betty.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't think so.  Rosa, I didn't kill Del... they did.

turns.speaker: LONNIE
turns.text: Blake, I can handle that transplant!

turns.speaker: BLAKE
turns.text: We need someone with the right kind of experience, Lonnie.

turns.speaker: LONNIE
turns.text: Even if he's falling asleep on his feet?

turns.speaker: BLAKE
turns.text: Lonnie, it's a complex procedure. Why don't you observe?

turns.speaker: LONNIE
turns.text: I'm not some snot-nosed resident fresh out of medical school, Blake.

turns.speaker: BLAKE
turns.text: No, you're not. You're a good doctor, Lonnie, but you're not David Ravell. I've made my decision. Now, if you'll excuse me...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What can I do for you, gentlemen?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How do you do, Mr. McCord. We're trying to locate a deranged fan of yours,... a Ms. Betty...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Deranged. That would be the right word.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That won't be necessary. She's staying with a Rosa something... Hernandez, Herrera. I know it's an 'H' sound... in Silverlake.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Thanks so much. You must get bothered by this kind of thing a lot.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: More than you know. Is there anything else?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No, that should be more than --

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What part of Dixie are you from, Duane?

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: Georgia. In case I didn't tell you, it's cash only, gentlemen.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: Here's Ghengis Kunt and The Demilitarized Zone. Get it?  They're Korean, so they're pretty hot.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You know, it's interesting. The South lost the Civil War, but they still seem to get all the glory.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Jeb Stuart, Stonewall Jackson, Jefferson Davis -- they're all losers in my book.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: The fuck you talking about?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Even Robert E. Lee was a loser.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: He goin' crazy on us, or what?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Did you know the most brutal, inhumane prison of the entire war was in Georgia?

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: Really. And where was that, old man?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Andersonville.  They did horrible things to men there...

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: ...you can have the best damn running backs in the world, somebody's still gotta block for 'em.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're a hundred percent right. They rely on what's-his-name's arm too much...

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: If you ate at the Tip Top you did.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh, yes, with the coffee...

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Yep, Betty pours a pretty mean cup.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I like this. I like doing business in the home. It's cozy...  Who's birthday?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Ahh... my wife's.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: All right gentlemen, let's get down to it. I need to know if you're for real.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: If we're for real?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: You don't exactly look like drug dealers.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: We appreciate that. But you just poured me a drink, I'd like to enjoy your hospitality for a few minutes.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Fine. You got five...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's a nice place you got here. Real comfortable. Sweet little town, Fair Oaks. You like it here?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Are you kidding me? What's to like?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: It's a small town, man. I never should have left Omaha. People here think small. They act small. They're a bunch of dumb fucks.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Could you give us an example?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Of what?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm asking you for an example of one of these dumb fucks being a dumb fuck.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: I don't follow...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're not a dumb fuck, are you, Del?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I didn't think so. So, give me an example of a stupid person doing a stupid thing. Not being stupid, you're equipped to recognize it.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Are we gonna do business here, or not?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: All right... lemme see... okay, new Burger King opens up. These assholes get excited and start lining up. Like it's some five star restaurant. The place is mobbed. Right?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Hmmmm. "Five Stars," huh?  Is that stupid, Wesley?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You did not just say "Injuns," Del.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: The Indians, Injuns, whatever. They're always drunk and doing stupid things.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Driving their cars into trees... puking on the sidewalk... stupid shit!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Let's see... around here that would be Kiowa, Kickapoo or Osage, if I'm not mistaken.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: I... I don't know...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well, my idea of stupid is very different from yours.  So here's how this is gonna work. Would you take your socks off, please?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: My socks?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Oh, Jesus, please... Please, God.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: ...and put them in your mouth.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Bourbon, little water, thank you.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Beer, please.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Hey... you got a fine one right here!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Wesley...  Your wife's a very lovely woman. Have I seen her before?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Relax, we brought the cash.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm just curious. Can't you give me an example?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: No, that's ignorant. They just don't know any better.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That's what I thought.  You better give me another example.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Stupid is trying to sell it to other people who are, by their very nature, untrustworthy.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: That is so right.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Stupid is calling people in Kansas City who are affiliated with the rightful owners of the thing you stole, and trying to sell it to them. Right Wesley?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Now, that's really stupid.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So you see, we have totally different ideas of what's stupid and what's not. Don't we?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You know, a hundred and fifty years ago you'd have been scalped for that remark about Native Americans. Right here where your house is -- you'd have been scalped.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Hell of a way to die.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It wasn't always fatal, Wesley. We could scalp Del right now, and he'd be plenty alive to tell us how it feels.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Hold still, Del, we're just talking here...  Then you grab a big handful of hair and pull as you cut. It's amazing how easily the scalp comes off.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: A mark, huh?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm all for them owning casinos, getting rich off the white man's greed. It's a beautiful piece of irony, isn't it, Wesley?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: IT SURE IS!!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Are you out of your mind? You scalped him!

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: You told me how to do it!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That was to get him to talk!  Get rid of that thing, will you?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: This is great -- just great! Now we don't know where the goddamn stuff is.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: He told us it's in the Buick.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: We don't know which Buick, do we?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Well, why'd you shoot him?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I had to shoot him! It was the only decent thing to do.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I still don't understand how you knew Del was telling the truth.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I saw his soul Wesley. He was face to face with his God, and no one lies in that situation. But your Geronimo act rattled me, and I abandoned my instincts.  Never abandon you instincts.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I didn't. You gave me a look!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What 'look'?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: That one look you got! I thought you were done, so I took him out...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I wasn't done, I was just sick of hearing him whine. And you didn't take him out, you scalped him. Christ, I almost puked, did I tell you that?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Well, why'd you have to tell that Indian story?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What the hell does that mean? If I'd told a Ty Cobb story would you have clubbed him to death with a bat?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's not here. Let's go.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: You just gonna leave these cars sitting here like this?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Why not, it'll confuse 'em... gotta do something, now that you fucked it up.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I wanted to make a statement.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Let me tell you something. In our business you can't put food on the table if your phone doesn't ring. The guys who get the calls are good -- not flashy, just good. They get in, they get out. Nobody knows a goddamn thing. Understand? Boom, boom, boom. Three in the head and you know they're dead.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: ...that's a good motto.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Fine, I'll get you a bumpersticker, but you better start believing it! It's the only statement you need to make.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Mmmm. Well, it was a piece of luck running into you, Duane. I thought I was gonna have to take Wesley out and hose him down. All he talks about is those Japanese gals.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I like 'em small. When you're inside a little Asian chick, it's like your dick is the axle that holds her body together.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: We can live with that.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'm a Yankee, myself. Massachusetts.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Del's dead, by the way. I sent him to the Great Beyond.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Actually, I scalped him, and then you killed him.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: He's telling the truth. He doesn't know.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Should I kill him now?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Wait. Any last words, General Lee?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What the hell was that, another statement?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Well, no one ever spit in my face before. Especially some cracker fuck.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You have to rise above it. The professionals rise above that kind of thing...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: So how do we know that car's still in Fair Oaks?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: We don't. But a '97 Le Sabre'll be easy to find if it's here, town this size...  He said he gave his wife some car as a gift, remember?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Maybe you don't appreciate the gravity of this situation. It's bad enough that we don't have what we came here for. It's worse that we don't know where it is. And now this.  This was supposed to be my last job. I already put the deposit down on my boat.  How can you eat at a time like this? I get nauseous just watching you...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I can eat because I know we didn't kidnap that woman. I can eat because they aren't looking for us. And I can eat 'cause I'm fucking hungry...  ...relax. She's gonna end up on a milk carton and that's about it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I hope you're right...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: ...I know I am. Let's just do what we gotta do here, and get the fuck gone.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So she gets rid of the asshole and is set for life in the same day.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: You think so? Joyce says she's timid.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Joyce was screwing Del.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: ...among others.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I'd say that about torches her credibility, wouldn't you?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Yeah, well, if the wife's trying to sell it she'll fuck up. She's an amateur, just like Del was.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No, I see Betty as a Midwestern Stoic type. Ice water in her veins. A clear thinker. Probably a Swede or a Finn.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: A 'Finn?' What is a Finn?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You should read more. Listen to me. I think this woman was waiting for a chance to do this, and we gave it to her. She kept to herself for years, living with a pompous asshole. Then she sees her opportunity, and BOOM! -- she leaves that little mudpatch in the dust. These heartlanders can't figure it out, 'cause that's not their sweet little Betty. Hah! We've been tracking her for, what, three days and I already understand her better'n most the people in that shitty little burg.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Betty, Betty, Betty...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: So what the fuck's a Finn?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh, for Chrissakes. It just means the kind of person who can eat shit for a long time without complaining, then cut their momma's throat and go dancing the same night.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Like... us?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No,... like a worthy adversary, Wesley. Like a very worthy adversary.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Wise beyond her years, I'm sure, and such poise, too.  Very, very impressive...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Well, then, did you ever get any indication that she wanted to leave her husband?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Thas' it, thas' it... conquer that bitch.  What time're they coming?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's not an exact science, Wesley. He said they'll be here... My Houston contact has always been very reliable.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: And then we're gonna do her right here. Right?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're always so coarse... "Do her right here." Let's just see what happens, okay?  "I wish that I could find a way; To speak my thoughts on Mother's Day. There are no words that quite express; My gratitude or happiness. A pleasant smile perhaps a kiss; I would not fail to give her this. I'd make her glad the whole day through; By sayin' 'Mother', I love you!' P.S. I wish I could say this to my mother's face, but I can't anymore."

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Let's get out of here. We got another long drive ahead of us.  ...the fuck where I do not know, but I know it's gonna be long.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Betty would never dress like that. She's not some trailer park slut!

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Okay, thank you, goodbye... Keep in touch...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: ...She's got class, and poise. Lots of poise...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: They said find it. Find her, find it. Finish the job you were paid to do.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Half.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: They paid us half. They still owe us half...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: There it is again. That lousy attitude that got us here in the first place. That "make a statement," do an end zone dance, shake your ass and sue everybody in sight attitude that's dragging this whole country down the drain.  They don't owe us shit, Wesley! WHEN YOU FINISH THE JOB, YOU GET PAID!! WE HAVEN'T FINISHED THE GODDAMN JOB!!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That woman could be in any one of four states. Four big states where the deer and the antelope play, Wesley! We're not in Rhode Island!

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: AND TURN THAT FUCKING MUSIC OFF!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Do I deserve this? In the twilight of my career, do I deserve this? I don't think so! I've always tried to do what's right. I never took out anybody who didn't have it coming. I'm a professional!  AND WHERE THE FUCK AM I? I'M IN PURGATORY!

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Worse... you're in Texas.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well, I should be in FLORIDA now! If Carl hadn't gone in to get those stones removed, you wouldn't be here and I'd be on my way to the Keys. On my boat, RELAXING WITH A GLASS OF PORT!! Re-ti red!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You don't look comfortable here. That's 'cause you don't like being the center of attention, do you? Nah. You're like me.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: What the hell's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That was a really shitty thing to do.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I'm sick of looking at her mother- fucking face.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: What? What does she represent?! What could some cornbread white bitch from Kansas who's dragging our sorry asses up and down the Louisiana Purchase possibly mean to you?!! I'd just love to know...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I dunno... something.  Why is she doing this to me? Why?...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I don't know, but when we find her she's gonna die for it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How'd they describe her?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: You know, blonde, thin, whatever...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Not so fast! Slower... 'blonde, thin', yes... Did they say she had style? A kind of grace or anything?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: We should go.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: We don't have time to look at a hole in the ground. We can make Vegas in four hours. This one's got to be her.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's a very moving experience, trust me.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: One of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: No... be dark before we get there. You wanna see the Grand Canyon at night?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What difference does it make? She wasn't in Kansas City, or Houston, or Dallas. We went to every goddamn place Del mentioned and no Betty. So what the hell makes you think she's in Vegas? You think she's waiting for us with tassles on her titties? Vegas is too crass for Betty.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I said, 'No.' N-O.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: "When I grow up I'm going to become a nurse or a veterinarian. I always want to help people and value all life, be it animal, plant or mineral..."  Does that sound like a goddamn showgirl to you?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Do you hear yourself right now...? Like a fucking madman...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Every American should see the Grand Canyon. Are you an American?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Yes, I am and we're not going. Act professional.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Well, guess what? I found Betty... where she's been, anyway.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Where? Where is she?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I'm not telling.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I'm not telling 'til you straighten up. You been acting like fucking Jerry Lewis on me and this shit's gotta stop or you can forget about your Betty... I mean it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: This doesn't look like the kind of place Betty would go to.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Maybe she had to use the bathroom. She pees, doesn't she?!...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So you believed the bartender. Why?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Well... I think I saw her soul.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That's good. You're learning. But let me tell you why I know she was lying.  First off, Betty would never fall for a soap star. It's beneath her.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I dunno, that lady sounded pretty sure...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No, no, Betty came here strictly for business, 'cause it's the biggest market for what she's selling. I should have known it all along. I'm kicking myself as I shave here. So, first thing we...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Wait, wait, wait a minute... that doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What doesn't?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: You gimme this bullshit Psychic Friends theory, you believe that dumbshit trucker, you believe this woman...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I never said that I believed...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: No, you believed her, we drove all the way to L.A. so that means you trusted her that much... so why's the rest of her story suddenly so kooky? Huh?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: 'Cause I just don't buy it. Call it instinct. Call it 35 years of professional know-how...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I call it 'nutty' as my shit after I eat Almond Roca...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You need to remember who you're talking to...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I need to get my goddamn head examined.  You can't rule something out on a whim. Or because she's cute. I've been following your whims all across the U.S. of A. and now I'm tired! Me!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Wesley...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: "It's beneath her..." She's a mother fucking housewife... nothing's beneath her!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: A doctor on the show... why?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: What in the...  What the hell is this? You've been holding out on me. All this fucking time!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It just didn't fit her profile...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Fuck the profile! That's the same guy!!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: She can't be here because of a... a soap opera. Not a soap opera. That'd make her...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: ...crazy! No shit, Shaft!! And you ain't far behind...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: ...but she's, no, Betty's smarter than that. She wouldn't be here for a...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I do not know how the fuck you lasted an hour in this job! Dragging our asses around with the answer to our prayers in your motherfucking jacket... a picture of that cunt right next to the...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Don't  Don't you talk about Betty like that. I don't care who she ends up being, you never use that word again. Got it?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Man, you have got to get some therapy.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I said 'got it?'

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: ...yeah, I got it.  Come on, you're stretching out my vest...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You made your point...  I was wrong.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: You were right. Del wasn't lying.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well, you were right about what that bartender said.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What do your instincts tell you to do now, kid?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Leave. Take this shit back to Detroit and get the rest of our money.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: We could do that. I could be on my way to Florida, and you could go to Thailand and fuck your brains out.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: ...but that's not what we're gonna do, is it?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No... if we don't finish this job, how are we gonna look at ourselves in the mirror? This is it for me, Wesley, she's the last one. My instinct says I gotta see this through with her, and if there's one thing I've tried to teach you here --

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: It's to follow my instincts. And my instincts say get the fuck out of Dodge.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No, I said to follow 'my' instincts. Now, we go up there and conclude our business. Case closed.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Not her mouth...  I've spent many long hours in a car with your face staring back at me. I've seen it painted on the horizon.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: What's wrong with you?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: This is Betty at twelve.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Very graceful. Perfect form.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Betty was a lovely child.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I don't like talking bad about the dead, but now that he's gone I can tell you she put up with things in that marriage I wouldn't have. And yes, she, of all people, was the one who defended him. And that's why what that sheriff said makes me so angry.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: If anyone had paid to have that husband of hers killed, it would have been me.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Mrs. Blaine? I can tell you right now, without a doubt, that your granddaughter is alive, and did not kill Del Sizemore.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: ...and how long did she work here?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Oh, five years, give or take.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Hmm... you two in high school together?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Aren't you a sweetheart... no, not quite. Anyway, she's been with us awhile.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: But she wanted more out of life, right?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: No... she just wanted something outta life. Anything. And with Del, she wasn't getting nothing. That's her husband, Del. I'm sorry about what happened and all, but that's the way I feel about all of this...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I see.  May I?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: If it helps bring her back, be my guest...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Thank you for your cooperation.  Just one more thing... did she ever talk about getting rich?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: ...who doesn't?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: What'd you get her?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Huh? Oh, umm, a car.  So, to a successful transaction...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Isn't that the point?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Yeah, well, I don't have time to screw around. I got buyers in Dallas, Houston and Vegas who are ready to snap this stuff up.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Seems like a nice place.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: It is, if you like idiots...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: You better believe it.

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Jesus Christ!

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: He's waiting...

turns.speaker: DEL
turns.text: Okay, uh... the, umm, Injuns're stupid.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: "Injuns?"

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: Alright, I admit it, you had me there. You're better than most of them, anyway... do you have a headshot?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, wait... what happened next, Betty?

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: Are you sure you want to encourage this?  No, you're right, let's have some fun. So, what did happened next, "Betty"?

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: Funny, that's just what I was thinking...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can't tell you how much it hurts me to hear that you married him.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Right, uhh... I feel terrible about this, we have a prior engagement at another party.  But... I'd be honored if you'd come.

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: Yeah, bring your friend along. I'm sure you got a lot of catching up to do...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She makes me stretch! I got inside my character last night like I haven't done in six years on "Reason". It was a totally rejuvenating experience.

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: I know, George, I was there. I'm not denying that she's good.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She's even taken a job as a nurse!  David Ravell's getting boring, Lyla.

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: We know that...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Can I have an evil twin?

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: No, George, we've already done that with Lonnie. The blind one last year, remember?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, of course. Who can forget the Emmy?  Then let me bring Betty to the set and see what happens.

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: I don't know, George...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll tell the cast ahead of time. What do you say?

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: I'll think about it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It'll be like live television! Let's live on the edge a little. You and I can break the mold here!

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: I said I'll think about it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Fine, but promise me one thing. If we use her, I want to direct those episodes. She's my discovery.

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: Actually, she was my discovery... just like you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hmm?

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: "Would you like ground pepper on that salad, Ms. Branch?" Remember?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: ...yeah.
